general_info.summary: This document outlines various programs and services offered by Sharda University, including academic departments like the School of Dental Sciences and Schools of Medical and Nursing Sciences. It also lists administrative and informational resources such as examination reports, academic bank of credits, university brochures, and details about leadership, history, and statutory bodies. Additionally, it highlights student support initiatives, skill development programs, entrepreneurship, and FM radio services, alongside guidelines for international students and specific university campuses in Uzbekistan and Agra.

eligibilityCriteria.academic: Completion of a secondary school diploma with a minimum GPA of 3.0.
eligibilityCriteria.language: TOEFL score of 80 or IELTS score of 6.5.

eligibilityCriteria.academic: Bachelor's degree in a related field with a minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.
eligibilityCriteria.language: TOEFL score of 90 or IELTS score of 7.0.
eligibilityCriteria.other: GRE scores are optional but recommended.

career_paths.summary: This text outlines a diverse range of career paths available after completing a yoga course. These options span various sectors including teaching at studios, gyms, wellness centers, schools, and corporate environments, as well as specialized roles like yoga therapy, personal coaching, and management within wellness centers. The list also includes entrepreneurial ventures, research, academia, content creation, consulting for health programs, and the possibility of pursuing advanced studies in Yoga.
career_paths.raw_content:
Career path you can choose after the course
• Yoga Instructor – at studios, gyms, and wellness centers
• Yoga Therapist – in hospitals and rehabilitation clinics
• Corporate Yoga Trainer – for workplace wellness programs
• School Yoga Teacher – integrating yoga in education
• Personal Yoga Coach – for individual clients or groups
• Wellness Center Manager – managing holistic health services
• Entrepreneur – start your own yoga studio or retreat
• Research Assistant – in yoga and wellness studies
• Academic Lecturer – teach in yoga institutions or colleges
• Yoga Content Creator – for online platforms and apps
• Consultant – in government or NGO health programs
• Further Studies – pursue Master’s or PhD in Yog
